data.title: feature request: please provide daily builds for export templates
data.body: Useful for testing work in progress depending on newer features than 1.0 stable....

data.title: fixed build error on OSX from new WM code
Implement combine mode for area
data.body:
Slower implementation of #1559 that does not break when area priority is changed programmatically.
The area order calculation is done on every integration step.

data.title: fixed iphone build with new window management changes
File.file_exists() can't find images if exported with "Compress for disk" option
data.body: No errors displayed.

data.title: KinematicBody with CollisionShape (sphere shape or capsule shape, or ray shape) stuck.
data.body:
Ray shape get stuck in any of the cases, if in the beginning it can a little move, but then got stuck and nothing more can be done at all, even the jump is not happening!

The capsule shape and sphere shape may for a long time moved, and it seems that there are no problems and everything seems to work fine.
BUT! this is not true! At some point, going on with them the same as with the ray shape it just stuck, and never come move.
This effect is very often occur when the grid moves along the map surface, it is possible that this is happening at the moment when shape reaches the junction point between the tiles of static bodies of grid map.
By the way a lot of problems also occur when sphere shape or capsule shape, touch the walls of which have a boss or pimple, and then it stuck as a result, but sometimes from the bulge, you can retreat, and again move freely.

To see how it breaks in the demo kinematic_char_3D, you just need to replace the body shape "Cubio" on the ray shape. and make an attempt to move and jump.

data.title: Latest windows build crashes when opening project.
data.body:
Errors:

![shot_150323_161823](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7307968/6783115/59d8e148-d178-11e4-8ad1-061c5e3915e9.png)

data.title: Implementing Area space_override_mode = COMBINE
data.body:
Vector can now insert elements in order via BodySW::ordered_insert (given the < operator is defined for the objects).
BodySW now uses Vector to store areas and insert them ordered by priority.
Gravity gets combined until the first REPLACE area is found (density is always set as the density of the area with highest priority)

data.title: Compile fix for android build
Camel casing being capitalized only happens in the inspector now.
data.body: Fixed camel casing being in the capitalize function. It now only occurs when setting the text for the inspector.

data.title: We need CI to prevent commits break builds easily
data.body: Notice that there're more and more build failure recently, I think it's time to integrate CI build into the main repository. ( I've setup some very basic travis-ci script on my fork: https://travis-ci.org/marynate/godot) So we can easily identify if a PR will break builds before merging into main repo.

data.title: new_wm_api -- window_management-demo fix
data.body: adjustments to the window_management demo to the new function names

data.title: Shader not work on TileMap
data.body: I add a material with shader to a TileMap, but no effect.

data.title: Fixed X11 window API function calls
data.body: Just had to change these to the new names. Tested all of the functions and they seem to work well.

data.title: New API: build fixes for x11
Compile fix for Windows provided by UsernameIsAReservedWord
data.body: Forgot to add the new function to the header, sorry.

data.title: Add missing iostream include to editor_import.collada.cpp
data.body: I was trying to build in Ubuntu 14.10 with gcc 4.9.1, and this file was giving me a multitude of errors along the lines of "cout is not a member of std". Seems to me that if the file is referencing cout and endl, it should include iostream, and in any case this patch allowed my build to proceed to completion.

data.title: android apk is broken
data.body: I have compiled several working custom android builds.  Most recent attempt has resulted in a broken apk.  Compiling under Ubuntu 14.04 32 bit.  Compilation succeeds and apk generation is successful, however when running on phone it immediately displays "Unfortunately, [app] has stopped."  My previous builds still work.  I have been staying current with master.  Is anyone else having this difficulty?

data.title: Revert "Camelcased script variables will now capitalize in the inspector...
data.body: Reverts okamstudio/godot#1401

data.title: Node2D can only snap on its top-left corner, it should be possible to snap on the node's center
data.body: ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10463138/6771606/15ac0044-d0e3-11e4-81b2-4e7caf2e8f68.png)

data.title: Godot's directory in Users/XXX/AppData/Roaming contains a space
data.body:
Hi,

With current source code, under Windows8.1, compiled using MSVC2010 (32 bits).

When you launch the fresh compiled godot.exe for the first time, it complains that editor_settings.xml does not exists. 
Then, it creates a brand new one into "C:/Users/XXX/AppData/Roaming/ Godot" with a SPACE character just before the G of Godot.

We thus end-up with two directories :
"C:/Users/XXX/AppData/Roaming/ Godot" (with the space)
"C:/Users/XXX/AppData/Roaming/Godot" (without the space)

I don't know which of the recent PR added this.

data.title: Reverted change to classHint
data.body:
This reverts the change made in 15bee515e63f8d9d93fc9aacd00f2b99e37cd58b

Using `char wmclass[] = "Godot"` causes `xprop` to
report the following for WM_CLASS:

`WM_CLASS(STRING) = "\200\326\322\365\377\177", "\200\326\322\365\377\177"`

This makes the Unity window manager in Ubuntu fail to connect the running app
with the icon on the launcher. This change fixes WM_CLASS so it reports "Godot" again.

data.title: [Bug] Android doesn't start

when I launch the app via the quicklaunch-button from Godot 1.0 or the exported file, I get the splashscreen and after around 20s a crash. Device is a Oneplus One with Android 4.4.4, Cyanogenmod.

data.title: Crash in Visual shader editor
data.body:
2015-03-16 build
- Create CurveMap in VSE
- Make some keypoints
- Try to delete someone by holding mouse and press delete
- Crash

data.title: Nicer Boot Logo Handling
data.body:
Hi,

I just set the boot logo with a 1280x720 JPEG. And now I ended up with a 5MB engine.cfg containing the image in a serialized way. What I expected: "res:\.....jpg" in it, some kind of reference.

data.title: Fix for Issue #1484: Don't strip whitespace on line comment
Fix issue #931: display current view name into editor's 3d scene viewpor...
data.body: ...ts
